Projects

Event Group

The BioSchemas Event Group develops and mantains a community specification for describing life science events.

Conferences, workshops, meetings and events in general play a very important role in knowledge sharing and acquisition of new skills. Though there are several technological solutions for event sharing, events in life sciences are still not described in a consistent manner that would make them easy to discover, exchange or compare. Because there is no single standard to follow, the dissemination, discovery and aggregation of events is not effective. As a result, the advertisement of an event in third party websites normally requires manual curation to shape the content to each provider's requirements.

Purpose

  • To develop a common schema to facilitate the description and dissemination of life science events, using schema.org.
  • To create a specification that includes a metadata schema, minimum information guidelines and recommended vocabularies. It should also include documentation and examples about how to use the event schema.
  • To engage the people that are interested in describing life science events to participate and shape the specification.

Specifications

The current specifications can be found in the Life Science Event Specification document, or you can check the entire list of BioSchemas Event properties. Usage examples can be found on the Examples page.

Property Expected Type Description Cardinality Content Guideline Controlled Vocabulary
hostInstitution Organization The organization or institution responsible for hosting the event (not necessarily responsible for organizing). Many Minimum
capacity Integer Available number of spaces. One Recommended
eligibility Text Defines the type of eligibility to attend this event (e.g. first-come first-served). Many Recommended Yes
socialMedia URL Link to social media websites like Twitter or Facebook. Many Optional

Membership

The Event Group is open to any organization or individual willing to contribute to the goals of this group. To become a member please send an email to event@bioschemas.org.

Chair

  • Martin Cook

Communication

Use the event@bioschemas.org mailing list for internal and external communication. You can apply to join this mailing list or see previous messages on the Google group Events web page.

Tasks and issues related to this group are available in GitHub issues section tagged with "type: event".

This group has regular calls as well as face to face meetings with the rest of BioSchemas groups. These can be followed on the Meetings page.
